plasma.name: KDE Plasma
plasma.description: Plasma desktop offers the most complete configurations and options inside a UI. The UI resembles Windows layout.

gnome.name: GNOME
gnome.description: GNOME is a modern desktop, the layout is different from other options but easy and intuitive to learn.

xfce.name: Xfce
xfce.description: Xfce is a lightweight desktop. It aims to be fast and low on system resources, while being rock solid.

mate.name: MATE
mate.description: The MATE desktop is a derivative of the now deprecated GNOME 2. It provides an intuitive desktop using traditional metaphors.

cinnamon.name: Cinnamon
cinnamon.description: Cinnamon is a desktop that follows traditional desktop conventions. The UI resembles Windows layout.

i3.name: i3 Window Manager
i3.description: i3 is a tiling X11 window manager, and not a complete desktop environment.

minimal.name: Minimal
minimal.description: Without desktop environment, suitable for advanced users that would like to build their own setups from the ground up.

plasma-mobile.name: Plasma Mobile
plasma-mobile.description: Phone UI based on KDE Plasma, built with KDE/QT and Kirigami technologies.

phosh.name: Phosh
phosh.description: Phosh is a UI based on GNOME technologies for mobile. It is the default graphical shell on Purismâ€™s commercial phones.

sway.name: Sway WM
sway.description: Sway is a tiling Wayland compositor and a drop-in replacement for the I3 window manager.
